image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Rome, Floyd County, Ga., September 14, 1888; attended the public schools of Rome, Ga., and the Piedmont Institute at Rockmart, Ga.; was graduated from the University of Georgia at Athens in 1910, from the law department of the same university in 1911, and from the Harvard University Graduate School in 1912; was admitted to the bar in 1911 and commenced practice in Rome, Ga.; chairman of the board of education of Rome, Ga., in 1918 and 1919; member of the State house of representatives 1929-1933 and 1937-1940; solicitor general of Rome judicial circuit 1941-1946; elected as a Democrat to the Eightieth and to the five succeeding Congresses and served from January 3, 1947, until his death due to a train collision with his automobile at a crossing in Rome, Ga., November 10, 1957; interment in Myrtle Hill Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the records of the Textile Workers Union of America (TWUA), Northwest Georgia Joint Board, 1949-1976, 5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Collection includes correspondence with Henderson Lanham, 1955-1957.

researchRecord.name: 1947-1957, 23.25 linear feet (47 boxes).
researchRecord.description: Collection includes subject files, correspondence, legislative files, case files, newspaper clippings, press releases, speeches, and political campaign material, as well as Lanham's committee activities. A finding aid is available online.

recordLocation.name: Richard B. Russell Library for Political Research and Studies
